meanings.definition: Fail to fire or explode properly
meanings.sent1: The old gun would misfire often during hunting trips.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the engine so it wouldn't misfire anymore.
meanings.sent3: The fireworks misfire made everyone laugh at the unexpected noise.
meanings.sent4: His plan to surprise her with flowers misfired when she found out beforehand.
meanings.sent5: The misfire of the rocket was a spectacular sight in the night sky.

meanings.definition: Fail to achieve the intended result
meanings.sent1: The team's strategy misfired, leading to a loss in the game.
meanings.sent2: She hoped her joke wouldn't misfire and offend anyone.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to cook dinner for the first time misfired, resulting in burnt food.
meanings.sent4: The misfire of his plan to surprise her with a gift left him disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The misfire of the experiment taught them what not to do next time.

meanings.definition: To fail to function properly or as expected
meanings.sent1: The old car would often misfire when starting in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight misfired, leaving them in the dark during the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the leaky faucet misfired, causing even more water to spill.
meanings.sent4: The misfire of the alarm clock made him late for work.
meanings.sent5: The misfire of the computer system caused chaos in the office.
